intro: Galium tehranicum, commonly known as the Tehran bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Iran. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and is characterized by its prostrate or ascending stems. Its small, white or pale pink flowers appear in clusters and bloom during the summer months. Galium tehranicum is often found in alpine meadows and is adapted to the cool, dry climate of its native habitat.
